#summary How to setup your config.php

Before this code will function as desire, you will need to create a config file. 

 # Inside the inc/ directory at the root of php-ups-api, you will find config_template.php. Copy this file to config.php in the same directory.
 # Follow the [http://forum.virtuemart.net/index.php?topic=66867.0 instruction here] to get the appropriate UPS credentials.
 # Fill in the access key with the key you received from UPS.
 # You may safely ignore the developer key.
 # For the server, you will want to use "https://wwwcie.ups.com" for  development and "https://onlinetools.ups.com" for production.
 # Fill in your UPS username and password in the appropriate places
